tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here the word "heart" represents the person's entire inner being and emotions. AT: "with all that I am" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: in the assembly of the upright, in their gathering
tn.text: These two phrases mean that same thing and may be combined if necessary. AT: "in the gathering of upright people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: eagerly awaited by all those who desire them
tn.text: The word "them" refers to the "works of Yahweh." This can be stated in active form. AT: "all those who desire the works of Yahweh eagerly await them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that people will always remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is an idiom that means to remember. AT: "remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The writer speaks of the land that belonged to the nations in Canaan as if it were their inheritance. AT: "the land that belonged to other nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here the word "hands" refers to Yahweh, himself. AT: "The works that he does" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

This means that Yahweh's instructions are unchangeable and will last forever. This can be stated in active form. AT: "He has established them forever" or "They will last forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: to be observed faithfully and properly
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) Yahweh has given his instructions in a faithful and proper manner or 2) his people are to observe Yahweh's instructions in a faithful and proper manner. This can be stated in active form. AT: "for his people to observe them faithfully and properly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: holy and awesome is his name
tn.text: Here the word "name" refers to Yahweh, himself. AT: "Yahweh is holy and awesome" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "wisdom" can be translated as a verb. AT: "the first step to becoming wise" or "the most important thing to become wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: those who carry out his instructions

tn.text: The word "praise" can be translated as a verb. AT: "People will praise him forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
